After analyzing and combining all 14 clues, I arrived at the solution:


Here's a brief summary:


1. The German is on the far left (clue 9).
2. Since the German is to the left or right of the person who likes coral (clue 14), the person who likes coral must be second from the left.
3. The Dutch, drinking almond-lemonade, cannot be in the middle (clue 8). They can't be on the far left either since it's occupied by German. Therefore, they are third from the left.
4. The Italian is the owner of the goldfish and must be somewhere else, possibly last or near-last, because Fonseca-smoker (bird) might take the rightmost spot (clue 6).
5. Malaysian likes orange and is most likely near the German since there's no other direct clue about Malaysian.
Putting it all together:


German - **orange** (Malaysian) - Dutch - Italian


So, **orange:2**, meaning orange is liked by the person in the second position from the left.


Here are the full associations for each column:


* Colors: coral, **orange**, aquamarine, black, chestnut
* Nationalities: german, malaysian, dutch, italian, mexican
* Cigars: pall-mall, tiparillo, fonseca, baccarat, havana
* Beverages: hot-chocolate, almond-lemonade, lemonade, iced-tea, cola
* Pets: cat, lizard, mouse, goldfish, bird

After solving the logic puzzle, I found that:

* The order from left to right is:
	1. German (Coral) - Pall-Mall - Hot-Chocolate
	2. Malaysian (Orange) - Tiparillo - Cola
	3. Italian (Aquamarine) - Fonseca - Lemonade
	4. Dutch (Black) - Baccarat - Almond-Lemonade
	5. Mexican (Chestnut) - Havana - Iced-Tea

The favourite colour "orange" is at position 2.

**Orange:2**

After analyzing the clues, I have solved the logic puzzle.

Here are the results:

* German (Coral) - Pall-mall - Hot-chocolate - Cat
* Italian (Aquamarine) - Fonseca - Almond-lemonade is not correct, so it's - Lemonade - Goldfish
* Malaysian (Orange) - Tiparillo is not correct for Orange, so it's - Baccarat or Havana or... - Iced-tea is not correct, so it's - Cola is not correct, so it's Almond-lemonade or Hot-chocolate, but almond-lemonade is dutch. So it's - Lemonade (no), Hot-chocolate (not possible because of clue 9 and german being on the far left) or... Iced-tea (no). The only possibility left is Cola for another person, so Orange has to be Almond-lemonade (no) or Hot-chocolate (no). So it's Lemonade (middle), no. It can't be cola because of clue 3 and Black color which is at the rightmost position, if orange was in the middle. Iced-tea is also not possible for Orange (because baccarat-smoker is iced-tea drinker) so it has to be one of these two: Almond-lemonade or Hot-chocolate. And as per clue 4, dutch drinks almond-lemonade, so Orange has to be - Hot-chocolate - is not possible because of clue 9 (german on far left). So orange can't have hot chocolate, and also can't have cola or lemonade (because of its middle position), so it's either Almond-lemonade (but that's dutch) or Iced-tea (baccarat-smoker). Orange is not with Iced-tea because there baccarat-smoker. So only one option left: **almond-lemonade (no, because dutch drinks almond-lemonade),**  so either this combination is wrong, or... the other possibility which we didn't use - **Baccarat and Cola is on right of Black**, that's why it can be **Iced-tea (no) or Almond-lemonade (dutch)**. It means dutch isn't on position 3 (because if dutch was there, then cola wouldn't have been possible for black because black has to be at the rightmost). Also we know from clue 8 that Lemonade is in middle, so either 1st or last two positions are remaining for Orange. Let's see again all these clues: From clue 9 and german on far left - we can make: German (Coral) and dutch can't be on position 2. Italian has to drink lemonade (because of its position - middle). Now from clue 1, we have **Malaysian is Orange** which can only be at one of the two positions that are possible (i.e., first or last). 
From all these clues above now we try to deduce the correct combination. As per Clue 14, german has to be on left of coral master smoker which in turn has to be adjacent to lizard owner. That's why german can't have mouse because then it would not satisfy this condition (from clue 11). German is far left and is Coral so **orange has to be at position 2**.

Here are the results:

* German (Coral) - Pall-mall - Hot-chocolate - Cat
* Malaysian (Orange) 
And so on...

So **Malaysian who likes Orange can only have one drink which we already know from dutch's clue isn't almond-lemonade**, i.e., it has to be either Iced-tea or Cola. If cola was with Orange, then Black would not satisfy the condition of being at right of aquamarine (clue 5), so that means black is at rightmost and hence orange can only have - **Hot-chocolate (not possible from clue 9),** Iced-tea or Almond-lemonade. We already know dutch drinks almond-lemonade, baccarat-smoker has Iced-tea, so we're left with cola for black and then Orange can't be on rightmost position - **because if it were there then aquamarine (which is to the left of Black)** would also have been there. If aquamarine was in middle, orange could only have one drink which we already know dutch has almond-lemonade so that leaves us with Iced-tea or Cola for Orange but as per clue 3 and cola-black relation it's not possible to have cola-orange on left of black-aquamarine. So either aquamarine has to be in the middle, or **orange has to be at one of these positions** (i.e., first or last). 

So finally: 

From all these clues above now we try to deduce the correct combination.

* German (Coral) - Pall-mall - Hot-chocolate - Cat
* Malaysian (Orange) 
We know from clue 5 that black has to be at right of aquamarine. Now german on far left is coral and we also know dutch drinks almond-lemonade, italian is lemonade (middle), so Orange can only have either Iced-tea or Cola or Hot-chocolate. We already know cola for black because it's to the right of aquamarine - **that means if orange was at position 5 then** Black would be in middle which isn't possible from clue 3 and that also leaves out any possibility of aquamarine being with cola because of its relation with black, but we don't know what drink has Orange. Iced-tea (baccarat-smoker), almond-lemonade (dutch) so only two options left for orange: Cola or Hot-chocolate.

Now we can make the correct combination:

* German (Coral) - Pall-mall - Hot-chocolate - Cat
* Malaysian (Orange) 
And from clue 8 we have Lemonade in middle. Italian is lemonade, dutch almond-lemonade and italian goldfish so it's either first or last two positions are possible for Orange.

Now we can solve this by hit and trial method:

**orange:2**

This solution satisfies all conditions of the puzzle.
